alert.note: Alert for Graham; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 3:36AM EDT until August 15 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Graham County north and west of Lake Santeetlah, and Swain County, west of Welch Ridge. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Elevated streamflows are expected along Yellow Creek and its tributaries, as successive waves of rainfall continue over the next few hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Town Of Santeetlah, Fontana Village, Smoky Mountains- Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Fontana Lake, Lake Santeetlah, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, Deals Gap and Tapoco. Additionally, localized areas of minor flooding and ponding are expected near Yellow Creek Road and Slick Rock Road, especially at locations where these roads intersect streams. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
